msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

author.persName: Ṭūsī, Naṣīr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1201-1274

msItem.title: Akhlāq-i Naṣīrī.
msItem.note: The initial entry is written in the Library copy of Codrington. On the colophon page, three impressions of the small oval seal of 'Ismatallah Siddiqi, dated 1159, one of which obscures the name of the scribe. Folio one, recto. A table calculating the size of the MSS by pages, lines and letters. The scribe acknowledges the help of Mihr 'Ali Khan. Headings and punctuation in red.

handNote.persName: 'Ismat allah son of Shaikh Zand (?) b. Muhibb 'Ali, owner of 'Alawalpur (?) Hakdhari (?) in the parganah of Shahjahanpur, Bihar

origin.p: Apparently 'Azimabad (Bihar) in the Subah of 'Ali Wirdi Khan. 14 Dhu 'l-Hijjah A.H.1152 (25 May 1739), 1147 Fasli, 22nd regnal year of Muhammad Shah.

acquisition.p: Presented by S. Ameer Ali. (So in original entry.)

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
